channel.title: Green weird loading bar thingy on Mopar?
channel.description:
I don't know if anybody's noticed this or maybe its just me, but very rarely when I navigate through Mopar the head might show a green slip (the whole part where MoparScape logo is) and I think it says loading but the page changes too quickly for me to read it.
Is it just me or has anybody else ever noticed it?

item.title: Green weird loading bar thingy on Mopar?
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

Usually this happens in SMF for actions that trigger something to load with Javascript.

Read full topic
item.source: Green weird loading bar thingy on Mopar?

item.title: Green weird loading bar thingy on Mopar?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

The loading bar will appear for other actions, it just so happens that editing topic titles will cause it to appear more. You’ll notice the bar a hell of a lot more when the forums are being slow.

Read full topic
item.source: Green weird loading bar thingy on Mopar?

item.title: Green weird loading bar thingy on Mopar?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

I actually found how to do this; You can edit your thread titles by double clicking it which the loading bar flashes on

Read full topic
item.source: Green weird loading bar thingy on Mopar?

item.title: Green weird loading bar thingy on Mopar?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

it happens when you try and edit a topic name you own

item.title: Green weird loading bar thingy on Mopar?

item.source: Green weird loading bar thingy on Mopar?

item.title: Green weird loading bar thingy on Mopar?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Ruby:

That’s in every SMF package, it changes colour depending on what is defined in the theme. On the core theme it’s green but on other’s its orange etc.

K i’m not going blind. Thanks

Read full topic
